summary.long: Mark is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As it is written in the Prophets:
“Look, I am sending My messenger before Your face,
    who will prepare Your way before You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The voice of one crying in the wilderness:
‘Prepare the way of the Lord,
    make His paths straight.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John came baptizing in the wilderness and preaching a baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole region of Judea and all the people of Jerusalem went out to him and were all baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John was clothed with camel’s hair and with a leather belt around his waist. And he ate locusts and wild honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He preached saying, “After me is coming One mightier than I, the straps of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and untie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I indeed have baptized you with water, but He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Coming up out of the water, He immediately saw the heavens opened and the Spirit descending on Him like a dove.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a voice came from heaven, saying, “You are My beloved Son in whom I am well pleased.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit immediately drove Him into the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He was there in the wilderness for forty days, tempted by Satan, and was with the wild beasts. And the angels ministered to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After John was put in prison, Jesus came to Galilee preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand. Repent and believe the gospel.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: As He walked by the Sea of Galilee, He saw Simon and Andrew, his brother, throwing a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Come, follow Me, and I will make you fishers of men.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Immediately they left their nets and followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had gone a little farther from there, He saw James the son of Zebedee and John, his brother, who also were in the boat mending their nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately He called them. And they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired servants and followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went to Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath He entered the synagogue and taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were astonished at His teaching, for He taught them as one having authority, and not as the scribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In their synagogue there was a man with an unclean spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he cried out, “Leave us alone! What do You have to do with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have You come to destroy us? I know who You are, the Holy One of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be silent and come out of him!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When the unclean spirit had convulsed him and cried out with a loud voice, it came out of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, “What is this? What new teaching is this? With authority He commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately His fame spread everywhere throughout the region surrounding Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He came out of the synagogue with James and John, they went directly to the house of Simon and Andrew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The mother of Simon’s wife lay sick with a fever, and immediately they told Him of her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He came and took her by the hand and lifted her up, and immediately the fever left her. And she served them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the evening, when the sun had set, they brought to Him all who were sick and those who were possessed with demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole city was gathered at the door,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He healed many who were sick with various diseases and cast out many demons. And He did not let the demons speak, because they knew Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning, rising up a great while before sunrise, He went out and departed to a solitary place. And there He prayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon and those who were with Him followed Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they found Him, they said to Him, “Everyone is searching for You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Let us go into the nearby towns, that I may preach there also. For that is why I have come.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So He preached in their synagogues throughout Galilee and cast out demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A leper came to Him, pleading with Him and kneeling before Him, saying, “If You are willing, You can make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, moved with compassion, extended His hand and touched him, and said to him, “I will. Be clean.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: As soon as He had spoken, the leprosy immediately departed from him, and he was cleansed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sternly warned him, and sent him away at once,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “See that you say nothing to anyone. But go your way, show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing what Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Instead he went out and began to proclaim it widely and to spread the news around, so that Jesus could no more openly enter the city, but was out in remote places. And they came to Him from every quarter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, He entered Capernaum after some days. And it was reported that He was in the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately many were gathered together, so that there was no room to receive them, not even at the door. And He preached the word to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Him bringing one sick with paralysis, who was carried by four men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they could not come near Him due to the crowding, they uncovered the roof where He was. When they had broken it open, they let down the bed on which the paralytic lay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw their faith, He said to the paralytic, “Son, your sins are forgiven you.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But some of the scribes were sitting there, reasoning in their hearts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why does this Man speak such blasphemies? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately, when Jesus perceived in His spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, He said to them, “Why do you contemplate these things in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Which is easier to say to the paralytic: ‘Your sins are forgiven you,’ or to say, ‘Rise, take up your bed and walk’?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,” He said to the paralytic,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “I say to you, rise, and take up your bed, and go your way to your house.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Immediately he rose, picked up the bed, and went out in front of them all, so that they were all amazed and glorified God, saying, “We never saw anything like this!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went out again by the seaside, and the whole crowd came to Him, and He taught them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He passed by, He saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax collector’s station, and He said to him, “Follow Me.” And he rose and followed Him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: As Jesus was at supper in his house, many tax collectors and sinners also sat together with Jesus and His disciples. For there were many, and they followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the scribes and Pharisees saw Him eating with tax collectors and sinners, they said to His disciples, “How is it that He eats and drinks with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard it, He said to them, “Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick. I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now the disciples of John and of the Pharisees were fasting. And people came and said to Him, “Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but Your disciples do not fast?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Can the wedding guests fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast in those days.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “No one sews a piece of new cloth on an old garment, or else the new piece that covered it tears away from the old, and the tear is made worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins, or else the new wine bursts the wineskins, and the wine is spilled, and the wineskins will be marred. But new wine must be poured into new wineskins.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He went through the grain fields on the Sabbath. As they went, His disciples began to pluck the heads of grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees said to Him, “Look, why are they doing on the Sabbath what is not lawful?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Have you never read what David did, when he and those who were with him were in need and hungry:
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: how he went into the house of God, in the days Abiathar was the high priest, and ate the ritual bread, which is lawful only for the priests to eat, and also gave it to those who were with him?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then He said to them, “The Sabbath was made for man, and not man for the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Again, He entered the synagogue, and there was a man who had a withered hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They watched Him to see whether He would heal him on the Sabbath, so that they might accuse Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the man who had the withered hand, “Stand up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to them, “Is it lawful to do good or to do evil on the Sabbath, to save life or to kill?” But they kept silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had looked around at them with anger, being grieved for the hardness of their hearts, He said to the man, “Stretch your hand forward.” He stretched it out, and his hand was restored as whole as the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees went out and immediately took counsel with the Herodians against Him, how to kill Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus withdrew with His disciples to the sea. And a great crowd followed Him from Galilee and Judea
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jerusalem, and Idumea, and from beyond the Jordan. And those from Tyre and Sidon, a great crowd, when they heard what great things He did, came to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told the disciples to have a small boat ready for Him because of the crowd, lest they should crush Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He had healed many, so that all who had diseases pressed on Him to touch Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When unclean spirits saw Him, they fell down before Him, crying out, “You are the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He sternly ordered them not to make Him known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went up into the mountain and called to Him those whom He desired, and they came to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He ordained twelve to be with Him, and to be sent out to preach,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to have authority to heal sicknesses and to cast out demons:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon, whom He named Peter;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: James, the son of Zebedee, and John, the brother of James, whom he surnamed Boanerges (meaning Sons of Thunder);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas; and James the son of Alphaeus; and Thaddaeus, and Simon the Zealot;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they entered a house, and the crowd came together again, so that they could not even eat bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When His family heard of it, they went out to seize Him, for they said, “He is beside Himself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scribes who came down from Jerusalem said, “He is possessed by Beelzebub, and by the ruler of the demons He casts out demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He called them to Him and said to them in parables, “How can Satan cast out Satan?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if Satan rises up against himself and is divided, he cannot stand, but is coming to an end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one can enter a strong man’s house and plunder his goods, unless he first binds the strong man. Then he will plunder his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, all sins will be forgiven the sons of men, and whatever blasphemies they speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal condemnation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they said, “He has an unclean spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then His mother and His brothers came, and standing outside, they sent to Him, calling Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd sat around Him and said to Him, “Your mother and Your brothers are outside asking for You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “Who are My mother and My brothers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He looked around at those who sat around Him and said, “Here are My mother and My brothers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever does the will of God is My brother, and My sister, and My mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again He began to teach by the seaside. A large crowd was gathered before Him, so that He entered a boat and sat in it on the sea. And the whole crowd was by the sea on the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He taught them many things in parables and said to them in His teaching:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen! And take note: A sower went out to sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he sowed, some seed fell beside the path, and the birds of the air came and devoured it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some seed fell on rocky ground, where it did not have much soil, and soon it sprang up because it did not have deep soil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the sun rose, it was scorched. And because it had no root, it withered away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other seed fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked it, and it yielded no grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And other seed fell on good ground, and it yielded grain that sprang up and increased by thirty, sixty, or a hundred times as much.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to them, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He was alone, those who were around Him with the twelve asked Him about the parable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “To you is given the secret of the kingdom of God, but to those who are outside, everything is said in parables,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that
‘seeing they may see, and not perceive,
    and hearing they may hear and not understand;
lest they should turn, and their sins be forgiven them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to them, “Do you not understand this parable? How then will you understand all the parables?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sower sows the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are those beside the path, where the word is sown. But when they hear, Satan comes immediately and takes away the word which is sown in their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others, likewise, are seed sown on rocky ground, who, when they hear the word, immediately receive it with gladness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but have no root in themselves, and so endure for a time. Afterward, when affliction or persecution rises for the word’s sake, immediately they fall away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And others are seed sown among thorns, the ones who hear the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the cares of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the desires for other things entering in choke the word, and it proves unfruitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Still others are seed sown on good ground, those who hear the word, and receive it, and bear fruit: thirty, sixty, or a hundred times as much.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Is a candle brought to be put under a basket or under a bed and not to be set on a candlestick?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there is nothing hidden except to be revealed; neither is anything kept secret except to be proclaimed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Take heed what you hear. The measure you give will be measured for you, and to you who hear will more be given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For to him who has will more be given. And from him who has not will be taken, even what he has.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “The kingdom of God is like a man who scatters seed on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sleeps and rises night and day, and the seed sprouts and grows; he does not know how.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the earth bears fruit by itself: first the blade, then the head, then the full seed in the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the grain is ripe, immediately he applies the sickle because the harvest has come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “To what shall we liken the kingdom of God, or with what parable shall we compare it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a grain of mustard seed which, when it is sown in the ground, is the smallest seed on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet when it is sown, it grows up and becomes greater than all shrubs, and shoots out great branches, so that the birds of the air may nest in its shade.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With many such parables He spoke the word to them as they were able to hear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Without a parable He did not speak to them. But when they were alone, He expounded on all things to His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That same day, when the evening came, He said to them, “Let us go cross to the other side.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had sent the crowd away, they took Him in the boat just as He was. There were also other little boats with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A great wind storm arose, and the waves splashed into the boat, so that it was now filling the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was in the stern asleep on a pillow. They woke Him and said, “Teacher, do You not care that we are perishing?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He rose and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, “Peace, be still!” Then the wind ceased and there was a great calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Why are you so fearful? How is that you have no faith?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They feared greatly and said to one another, “What kind of Man is He, that even the wind and the sea obey Him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went to the other side of the sea to the region of the Gadarenes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had come out of the boat, immediately a man with an unclean spirit came out of the tombs and met Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lived among the tombs. And no one could constrain him, not even with chains,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he had often been bound with shackles and chains. But he had pulled the chains apart and broken the shackles to pieces. And no one could subdue him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Always, night and day, he was in the mountains and in the tombs, crying out and cutting himself with stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he saw Jesus afar off, he ran up and kneeled before Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and cried out with a loud voice, “What have You to do with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I adjure You by God, do not torment me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jesus said to him, “Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then He asked him, “What is your name?”
He answered, “My name is Legion. For we are many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he begged Him repeatedly not to send them away out of the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a great herd of swine feeding near the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the demons pleaded with Him, asking, “Send us to the swine, so that we may enter them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once, Jesus gave them leave. Then the unclean spirits came out and entered the swine. And the herd, numbering about two thousand, ran wildly down a steep hill into the sea and were drowned in the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who fed the swine fled and reported it in the city and in the country. And people went out to see what it was that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Jesus and saw him who had been possessed with the legion of demons sitting and clothed and in his right mind. And they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who saw it told them how it befell him who had been possessed with the demons and also concerning the swine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they began to plead with Him to depart out of their region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He entered the boat, he who had been possessed with the demons prayed Him that he might be with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus did not let him, but said to him, “Go home to your friends and tell them what great things the Lord has done for you and how He has had compassion on you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he departed and began to proclaim in the Decapolis what great things Jesus had done for him. And everyone was amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had crossed again by boat to the other side, many people gathered to Him. And He was beside the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the rulers of the synagogue, named Jairus, saw Jesus and came and fell at His feet
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and earnestly asked Him, “My little daughter is lying at the point of death. I ask You, come and lay Your hands on her, so that she may be healed. And she will live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Jesus went with him.
And many people followed Him and pressed in on Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain woman had a hemorrhage for twelve years,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and had suffered much under many physicians. She had spent all that she had, and was not better but rather grew worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she had heard of Jesus, she came in the crowd behind Him and touched His garment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For she said, “If I may touch His garments, I shall be healed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately her hemorrhage dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of the affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once, Jesus knew within Himself that power had gone out of Him. He turned around in the crowd and said, “Who touched My garments?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples said to Him, “You see the crowd pressing against You, and You say, ‘Who touched Me?’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He looked around to see her who had done it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the woman, fearing and trembling, knowing what had happened to her, came and fell down before Him and told Him the entire truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be healed of your affliction.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While He was still speaking, some came from the house of the synagogue ruler and said, “Your daughter is dead. Why trouble the Teacher any further?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken, He said to the ruler of the synagogue, “Do not be afraid, only believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He let no one follow Him, except Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and saw the tumult, and those who wept and wailed loudly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He came in, He said to them, “Why make this uproar and weep? The girl is not dead, but sleeping.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They laughed at Him in ridicule.
But when He had put them all out, He took the father and the mother of the girl and those who were with Him and entered where the girl was lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the girl by the hand and said to her, “Talitha cumi,” which means, “Little girl, I say to you, arise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the girl arose and walked, for she was twelve years of age. And they were greatly astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He strictly ordered them to let no one know of it and directed them to give her something to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went away from there and came into His own country. And His disciples followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Sabbath came, He began to teach in the synagogue. And many hearing Him were astonished, saying, “Where did this Man get this? What is this wisdom that is given Him, that even miracles are done by His hands?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is this not the carpenter, the Son of Mary and the brother of James and Joseph and Judas and Simon? Are not His sisters here with us?” And they took offense at Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country, and among his own relatives, and in his own house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He could not do any miracles there, except that He laid His hands on a few sick people and healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And He was amazed because of their unbelief.
Then He went to the surrounding villages, teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called to Him the twelve, and began to send them out two by two, and gave them authority over unclean spirits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded them to take nothing for their journey except a staff: no bag, no bread, and no money in their purse,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but to wear sandals, and not put on two tunics.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Wherever you enter a house, remain there until you depart from that place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever will not receive you or hear you, when you depart from there, shake the dust off your feet as a testimony against them. Truly I say to you, it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah on the Day of Judgment than for that city.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went out and preached that men should repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they cast out many demons and anointed with oil many who were sick and healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Herod heard of Him, for His name was spread publicly. He said, “John the Baptist has been raised from the dead, and therefore these miracles are at work in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But others said, “He is Elijah.”
And yet others said, “He is the Prophet, or like one of the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Herod heard of it, he said, “It is John, whom I beheaded. He has been raised from the dead!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod had sent and seized John and bound him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, for he had married her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John said to Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Herodias had a grudge against him and would have killed him, but she could not,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Herod feared John, knowing that he was a righteous and holy man, and protected him. When he heard him, he was greatly perplexed, but heard him gladly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a convenient day came when Herod on his birthday prepared a ceremonial dinner for his lords and commanding officers and leading men of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the daughter of Herodias came in and danced and pleased Herod and those who sat with him, the king said to the girl, “Ask of me whatever you desire, and I will give it to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he swore to her, “Whatever you ask of me, I will give you, up to half of my kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She went out and said to her mother, “What shall I ask?”
She said, “The head of John the Baptist.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She came in immediately with haste to the king and asked, “I want you to give me the head of John the Baptist on a platter at once.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king was extremely sorrowful. Yet for the sake of his oath and those who sat with him, he would not reject her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king immediately sent an executioner and commanded his head to be brought. He went and beheaded him in the prison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the girl. And the girl gave it to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his disciples heard of it, they came and took up his corpse and laid it in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles met with Jesus and told him everything, both what they had done and what they had taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to them, “Come away by yourselves to a remote place and rest a while,” for many were coming and going, and they had no leisure even to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went into a remote place privately by boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people saw them departing, and many knew Him and ran there on foot out of every city. They arrived first and came together to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came out and saw many people, He was moved with compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd. And He began to teach them many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the day was now getting late, His disciples came to Him and said, “This is a remote place, and now the time is passing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send them away into the surrounding country and villages to buy themselves bread, for they have nothing to eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But He answered, “You give them something to eat.”
They said to Him, “Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread and give it to them to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “How many loaves have you? Go and see.”
When they found out, they said, “Five, and two fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He commanded them to make everyone sit down by companies on the green grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they sat down in ranks, by hundreds and by fifties.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had taken the five loaves and the two fish, He looked up to heaven, and blessed and broke the loaves, and gave them to His disciples to set before them. And He divided the two fish among them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all ate and were filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments and of the fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who ate of the loaves were about five thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately He compelled His disciples to get into the boat and to go before Him to the other side, to Bethsaida, while He sent the crowd away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had sent them away, He departed to a mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening came, the boat was in the midst of the sea. And He was alone on the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw them straining at rowing, for the wind was against them. About the fourth watch of the night He came to them, walking on the sea and would have passed by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they saw Him walking on the sea, they supposed it was a ghost, and cried out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they all saw Him and were troubled.
Immediately He spoke to them and said, “Be of good cheer, it is I. Do not be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He went up to them in the boat and the wind ceased. They were greatly astonished in themselves beyond measure, and wondered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they had not comprehended the miracle of the loaves, for their hearts were hardened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had crossed over, they came to the land of Gennesaret and anchored on the shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had come out of the boat, immediately the people recognized Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ran throughout the surrounding region, and began to carry the sick on beds to wherever they heard He was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And wherever He entered, into villages, cities, or the country, they laid the sick in the marketplaces and pleaded with Him that they might touch even the fringe of His garment. And as many as touched Him were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees and certain scribes who came from Jerusalem gathered around Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw some of His disciples eat bread with defiled, that is, ritually unwashed hands, they found fault.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Pharisees and all the Jews, unless they wash their hands ritually, do not eat, keeping the tradition of the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they come from the market, unless they wash, they do not eat. And there are many other traditions which they have received and observe, such as the washing of cups and pitchers and bronze vessels and dining couches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Pharisees and scribes asked Him, “Why do Your disciples not live according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashed hands?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He answered, “Well has Isaiah prophesied of you hypocrites, as it is written:
‘These people honor Me with their lips,
    but their hearts are far from Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In vain do they worship Me,
    teaching as doctrines the precepts of men.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For laying aside the commandment of God, you hold the tradition of men—the washing of pitchers and cups, and many other such things you do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “You full well reject the commandment of God so that you may keep your own tradition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘Whoever curses father or mother, let him be put to death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you say, ‘If a man says to his father or mother, “It is Corban,” that is to say, “What you would have profited from me is a gift to God,” he shall be free.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you no longer let him do anything for his father or his mother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: making the word of God of no effect through your tradition, which you have delivered. And you do many similar things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had called all the people to Him, He said, “Listen to Me, every one of you, and understand:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is nothing from outside a man that by entering him can defile him. But the things which come out of the man are what defile him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had left the people and entered the house, His disciples asked Him concerning the parable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Are you so without understanding also? Do you not know that anything from the outside that enters a man cannot defile him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because it does not enter his heart, but into his stomach, and goes out into the sewer, thus purifying all foods?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said, “What comes out of a man is what defiles a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adultery, fornication, murder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: theft, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, licentiousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride and foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these evil things come from within and defile a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there He arose and went to the region of Tyre and Sidon. He entered a house and would have no one know it. Yet He could not be hidden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a certain woman, whose young daughter had an unclean spirit, heard of Him, and came and fell at His feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman was a Greek, a Syrophoenician by race. And she begged Him to cast the demon out of her daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Let the children first be filled. For it is not fitting to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She answered, “Yes, Lord. Yet the dogs under the table eat the children’s crumbs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to her, “For this answer, go your way. The demon has gone out of your daughter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she had come to her house, she found the demon had gone out, and her daughter lying on the bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, departing from the region of Tyre and Sidon, He came to the Sea of Galilee, through the region of the Decapolis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought to Him one who was deaf and had difficulty speaking. And they pleaded with Him to put His hand on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took him aside from the crowd, and put His fingers into his ears, and spat and touched his tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Looking up to heaven, He sighed, and said to him, “Ephphatha,” that is, “Be opened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately his ears were opened, and the impediment of his tongue was loosened, and he spoke correctly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He ordered them to tell no one. But the more He ordered them, the more they greatly proclaimed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were astonished beyond measure, saying, “He has done all things well. He makes both the deaf to hear and the mute to speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days, the crowds being very great with nothing to eat, Jesus called His disciples to Him and said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have compassion on the crowd, because they have now been with Me three days and have nothing to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I send them away fasting to their own houses, they will faint on the way, for some of them have come from afar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples answered, “Where can one get bread to feed these men here in the wilderness?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked them, “How many loaves do you have?”
They said, “Seven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded the people to sit down on the ground. Taking the seven loaves and giving thanks, He broke them and gave them to His disciples to serve. And they served the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they had a few small fish. And blessing them, He commanded that these also be served them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they ate and were filled. And they collected seven baskets of the broken pieces that were left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were about four thousand who had eaten, and He sent them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He immediately entered a boat with His disciples and came to the region of Dalmanutha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees came up and began to debate with Him, seeking from Him a sign from heaven to test Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sighed deeply in His spirit and said, “Why does this generation look for a sign? Truly I say to you, no sign shall be given to this generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He left them and, entering the boat again, departed to the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the disciples had forgotten to take bread and did not have more than one loaf with them in the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He warned them, “Take heed. Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They reasoned among themselves, saying, “It is because we have no bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Being aware of it, Jesus said to them, “Why do you reason that you have no bread? Do you still not perceive or understand? Are your hearts still hardened?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having eyes, do you not see? Having ears, do you not hear? And do you not remember?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you collect?”
They said to Him, “Twelve.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And the seven among the four thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you collect?”
They said, “Seven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Do you still not understand?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to Bethsaida. And they brought a blind man to Him and entreated Him to touch him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the blind man by the hand and led him out of the town. When He had spit on his eyes and put His hands on him, He asked him, “Do you see anything?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked up and said, “I see men as trees, walking.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then again He put His hands on his eyes and made him look up. And he was restored and saw everyone clearly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent him home away to his house, saying, “Neither go into the town, nor tell it to anyone in the town.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus and His disciples went out into the towns of Caesarea Philippi. On the way He asked His disciples, “Who do men say that I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered, “John the Baptist, but some say, Elijah; and others, one of the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
Peter answered Him, “You are the Christ.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He warned them that they should tell no one about Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders and the chief priests and the scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said this openly. And Peter took Him and began to rebuke Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when He had turned around and looked at His disciples, He rebuked Peter, saying, “Get behind Me, Satan! For you are not mindful of the things of God, but the things of men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had called the people to Him, with His disciples, He said to them, “If any man would come after Me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever would save his life will lose it. But whoever would lose his life for My sake and the gospel’s will save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what does it profit a man if he gains the whole world and loses his own soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or what will a man give in exchange for his soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever therefore is ashamed of Me and of My words in this adulterous and sinful generation, of him will the Son of Man also be ashamed when He comes in the glory of His Father with the holy angels.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “Truly I say to you, there are some standing here who will not taste death before they see the kingdom of God come with power.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After six days Jesus took with Him Peter and James and John and led them up a high mountain, alone by themselves. And He was transfigured before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His garments became shiny, extremely white as snow, such as no launderer on earth could whiten them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there appeared to them Elijah with Moses. And they were talking with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. Let us make three sanctuaries: one for You, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he did not know what to say, because they were very afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a cloud overshadowed them, and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is My beloved Son. Listen to Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, when they looked around, they no longer saw anyone with them except Jesus only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they came down the mountain, He warned them to tell no one what they had seen, until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept that statement to themselves, questioning each other what the rising from the dead meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked Him, “Why do the scribes say that Elijah must first come?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “Elijah indeed comes first to restore all things. Yet how is it written of the Son of Man that He should suffer many things and be treated with contempt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say to you that Elijah has indeed come, and they have done to him whatever they wished, as it is written of him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He came to His other disciples, He saw a great crowd around them, and the scribes disputing with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately when all the people saw Him, they were greatly amazed, and running to Him, greeted Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked the scribes, “What are you debating with them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One in the crowd answered, “Teacher, I brought You my son, who has a mute spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever it takes hold on him, it dashes him to the ground. And he foams at the mouth and gnashes with his teeth and becomes rigid. And I told Your disciples so that they would cast it out, but they could not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “O faithless generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you? Bring him to Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought the boy to Him. When he saw Him, immediately the spirit dashed him, and he fell on the ground and wallowed, foaming at the mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked his father, “How long has it been since it came to him?”
He said, “From childhood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Often it has thrown him into the fire and into the water to kill him. But if You can do anything, have compassion on us and help us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “If you can believe, all things are possible to him who believes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the father of the child cried out with tears, “Lord, I believe. Help my unbelief!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw that the people came running together, He rebuked the foul spirit, saying to it, “You mute and deaf spirit, I command you, come out of him, and enter him no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spirit cried out and convulsed him greatly. But it came out of him, and he was as dead, so that many said, “He is dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus took him by the hand and lifted him up, and he arose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had entered the house, His disciples asked Him privately, “Why could we not cast it out?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “This kind cannot come out except by prayer and fasting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They departed from there and passed through Galilee, and He did not want anyone to know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He was teaching His disciples, saying, “The Son of Man will be delivered into the hands of men, and they will kill Him. After He is killed, He will rise the third day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not understand the teaching and were afraid to ask Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to Capernaum. And being in the house, He asked them, “What was it that you disputed among yourselves on the way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they kept silent, for on the way they had disputed among themselves who was the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sat down and called the twelve. And He said to them, “If anyone desires to be first, he must be last of all and servant of all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took a child and set him in their midst. And when He had taken him in His arms, He said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever receives one of these children in My name receives Me. And whoever receives Me receives not Me, but Him who sent Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered Him, “Teacher, we saw one who does not follow us casting out demons in Your name, and we forbade him because he was not following us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Do not forbid him, for no one who does a miracle in My name can quickly speak evil of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he who is not against us is for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, whoever gives you a cup of water to drink in My name, because you belong to Christ, will not lose his reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in Me to sin, it would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck and he were thrown into the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your hand causes you to sin, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life maimed than with two hands to go into hell, into the fire that shall never be quenched,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
where
‘their worm does not die,
    and the fire is not quenched.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if your foot causes you to sin, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life lame than with two feet to be thrown into hell, into the fire that shall never be quenched,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
where
‘their worm does not die,
    and the fire is not quenched.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if your eye causes you to sin, pluck it out. It is better for you to enter the kingdom of God with one eye than with two eyes to be thrown into the fire of hell,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
where
‘their worm does not die,
    and the fire is not quenched.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone will be salted with fire, and every sacrifice will be salted with salt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Salt is good. But if the salt loses its saltiness, how will you season it? Have salt in yourselves, and have peace with one another.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He arose and went from there to the region of Judea to the other side of the Jordan, and the people came to Him again. And again, as was His custom, He taught them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees came to test Him, asking, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “What did Moses command you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Moses permitted a man to write a certificate of divorce and to divorce her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Due to the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from the beginning of the creation, God ‘made them male and female.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and cleave to his wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the two shall be one flesh.’ So then they are no longer two, but one flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What therefore God has joined together, let not man put asunder.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the house His disciples asked Him concerning this matter again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery against her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a woman divorces her husband and marries another, she commits adultery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought young children to Him, that He might touch them. But the disciples rebuked those who brought them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus saw it, He was very displeased and said to them, “Allow the little children to come to Me, and do not forbid them, for of such is the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall not enter it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He took them up in His arms, put His hands on them, and blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He set out on His way, a man came running and knelt before Him, and asked Him, “Good Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “Why do you call Me good? No one is good, except God alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not murder, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Do not defraud, Honor your father and mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered Him, “Teacher, all these have I observed from my youth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, looking upon him, loved him and said to him, “You lack one thing: Go your way, sell whatever you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. And come, take up the cross and follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was saddened by that word, and he went away grieving. For he had many possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked around and said to His disciples, “How hard it will be for those who have wealth to enter the kingdom of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were astonished at His words. But Jesus answered again, “Children, how hard it is for those who trust in riches to enter the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were astonished beyond measure, saying among themselves, “Who then can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, looking at them, said, “With men it is impossible, but not with God. For with God all things are possible.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter began to say to Him, “Look, we have left everything and have followed You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Truly I say to you, there is no one who has left a house or brothers or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or fields, for My sake and for the gospel’s sake,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who shall not receive a hundred times as much now in this age, houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and fields, with persecution, and in the age to come, eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many who are first will be last, and the last first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were on the way, going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus went ahead of them. And they were amazed, and those who followed were afraid. Again, He took the twelve aside and began to tell them what would happen to Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Listen! We are going up to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and the scribes, and they will condemn Him to death and hand Him over to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will mock Him, and scourge Him, and spit on Him, and kill Him. Then after three days He will rise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to Him, saying, “Teacher, we want that whatever we may ask, You would do for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “What do you want Me to do for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Grant us to sit, one at Your right hand and the other at Your left hand, in Your glory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to them, “You do not know what you are asking. Can you drink the cup that I drink and be baptized with the baptism with which I am baptized?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said to Him, “We can.”
Jesus said to them, “You will indeed drink the cup that I drink and be baptized with the baptism with which I am baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to sit at My right hand or at My left hand is not Mine to grant. It is for those for whom it has been prepared.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the ten heard it, they began to be very displeased with James and John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus called them together, and said, “You know that those who are appointed to rule over the Gentiles lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it shall not be so among you. Whoever would be great among you must be your servant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whoever among you would be greatest must be servant of all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even the Son of Man came not to be served, but to serve, and to give His life as a ransom for many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to Jericho. And as He went out of Jericho with His disciples and a great number of people, blind Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, sat along the way begging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many ordered him to keep silent. But he cried out even more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus stood still and commanded him to be called.
So they called the blind man, saying, “Be of good comfort. Rise, He is calling you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Throwing aside his garment, he rose and came to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus answered him, “What do you want Me to do for you?”
The blind man said to Him, “Rabbi, that I might receive my sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Go your way. Your faith has made you well.” Immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus on the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they drew near Jerusalem and came to Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives, He sent out two of His disciples
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “Go into the village opposite you. As soon as you enter it, you will find a colt tied, on which no one has ever sat. Untie it and bring it here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone says to you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say ‘The Lord has need of it,’ and immediately he will send it here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went their way and found the colt tied by the door outside on the street. And they untied it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of those who stood there said to them, “What are you doing untying the colt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered just as Jesus had commanded. And they let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the colt to Jesus and threw their garments on it. And He sat upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many spread their garments on the street. And others cut down branches off the trees and scattered them on the street.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who went before and those who followed cried out, saying:
“Hosanna!
‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the kingdom of our father David that is coming in the name of the Lord!
Hosanna in the highest!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus entered Jerusalem and went into the temple. When He had looked around at everything, as the hour was now late, He went out to Bethany with the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day when they had returned from Bethany, He was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing from afar a fig tree with leaves, He went to see if perhaps He might find anything on it. When He came to it, He found nothing except leaves, for it was not the season for figs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again.” And His disciples heard it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to Jerusalem. Jesus went into the temple and began to drive out those who sold and bought in the temple, and He overturned the tables of the moneychangers and the seats of those who sold doves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He would not allow anyone to carry any vessel through the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He taught them, and said, “Is it not written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer for all nations’? But you have made it a ‘den of thieves.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The scribes and chief priests heard it and looked for a way to kill Him. For they feared Him, because all the people were astonished at His teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening came, He went out of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree withered from the roots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter, calling to remembrance, said to Him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree which You cursed has withered away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Have faith in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For truly I say to you, whoever says to this mountain, ‘Be removed and be thrown into the sea,’ and does not doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says will come to pass, he will have whatever he says.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I say to you, whatever things you ask when you pray, believe that you will receive them, and you will have them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you stand praying, forgive if you have anything against anyone, so that your Father who is in heaven may also forgive you your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father who is in heaven forgive your sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came again to Jerusalem, and as He was walking in the temple, the chief priests and the scribes and the elders came to Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “By what authority are You doing these things, and who gave You this authority to do them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I will also ask of you one question. Answer Me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was the baptism of John from heaven or from men? Answer Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They debated among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From men’ ”—they feared the people, for everyone held John to be a real prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they answered Jesus, “We do not know.”
Jesus answered them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He began to speak to them in parables. “A man planted a vineyard, and set a hedge around it, and dug a pit for the winepress, and built a tower, and rented it to vinedressers, and went to a far country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At harvest time he sent a servant to the vinedressers to receive from them some of the fruit of the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they seized him and beat him and sent him away empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sent another servant to them. They threw stones at him, and wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully handled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Still he sent another, and they killed him. And there were many others. Some they beat, and some they killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Having yet his one well-beloved son, he sent him last to them, saying, ‘They will revere my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But those vinedressers said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took him and killed him and threw him out of the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What then will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and kill the vinedressers and give the vineyard to others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you not read this Scripture:
‘The stone which the builders rejected
    has become the cornerstone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This was the Lord’s doing,
    and it is marvelous in our eyes’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they tried to seize Him, but feared the people, for they knew that He had spoken the parable against them. So they left Him and went their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sent to Him some of the Pharisees and some of the Herodians to trap Him in His words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to Him, they said, “Teacher, we know that You are true and swayed by no man. For You do not regard the person of men, but truthfully teach the way of God. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should we pay, or should we not pay?”
But He, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them, “Why test Me? Bring Me a denarius that I may see it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They brought it, and He said to them, “Whose image and inscription is this?”
They said to Him, “Caesar’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus answered them, “Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
And they were amazed at Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to Him, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies and leaves his wife behind, but leaves no children, that man must take the wife and raise up children for his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were seven brothers. The first took a wife, and when he died, he left no children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second took her and died, leaving no children, and the third likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seven had her and left no children. Last of all, the woman died too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the resurrection, when they rise, whose wife will she be? For the seven had her as wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Do you not err, because you know neither the Scriptures nor the power of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning the dead rising, have you not read in the book of Moses, in the account about the bush, how God spoke to him, saying, ‘I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not the God of the dead, but the God of the living. You therefore do greatly err.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the scribes came and heard them reasoning together. Perceiving that Jesus had answered them well, he asked Him, “Which is the first commandment of all?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “The first of all the commandments is, ‘Hear, O Israel, the Lord our God is one Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind, and with all your strength.’ This is the first commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second is this: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The scribe said to Him, “Well said, Teacher. You have spoken the truth, that there is one God and there is no other but Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To love Him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, and with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love one’s neighbor as oneself, is more than all burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw that he answered wisely, He said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” After that, no one dared to ask Him any question.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus taught in the temple, He said, “How can the scribes say that Christ is the Son of David?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David himself, speaking by the Holy Spirit, declared:
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
    “Sit at My right hand,
until I put Your enemies
    under Your feet.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David himself calls Him ‘Lord.’ How then is He his Son?”
And the large crowd heard him gladly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them in His teaching, “Beware of the scribes, who love to go about in long robes and love greetings in the marketplaces,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the prominent seats in the synagogues, and the places of honor at banquets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who devour widows’ houses and for a pretense make long prayers. They will receive greater condemnation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sat opposite the treasury and saw how the people put money into the treasury. Many who were rich put in much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a certain poor widow came and put in two mites, which make a farthing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called His disciples to Him and said to them, “Truly I say to you, this poor widow has put in more than all those who are contributing to the treasury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all contributed out of their abundance. But she, out of her poverty, put in all that she had, her entire livelihood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He went out of the temple, one of His disciples said to Him, “Teacher, see what great stones and what great buildings are here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Do you see these great buildings? Not one stone shall be left upon another that shall not be thrown down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked Him privately,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell us, when will these things happen, and what will be the sign when all these things will be fulfilled?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Take heed lest anyone deceive you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am He,’ and will deceive many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be troubled. For such things must happen, but the end is still to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. And there will be earthquakes in various places, and there will be famines and troubles. These are the beginning of sorrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But take heed. For they will hand you over to councils, and in the synagogues you will be beaten. You will be brought before rulers and kings for My sake, as a testimony to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the gospel must first be preached to all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they arrest you and hand you over, take no thought beforehand, or premeditate what you should speak. But speak whatever is given you in that time, for it is not you who speaks, but the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now a brother will betray his brother to death, and the father the son; children will rise up against their parents, and will cause them to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be hated by all men for My name’s sake. But he who endures to the end shall be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you see the ‘abomination of desolation’ spoken of by Daniel the prophet standing where it should not be (let the reader understand), then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him who is on the housetop not go down or enter the house to take anything out of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him who is in the field not turn back to take his garment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But woe to women who are pregnant and to those who nurse in those days!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray that your escape may not be in winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in those days there will be distress as has not been from the beginning of the creation which God created to this time, nor ever shall be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Except the Lord shortened the days, no flesh would be saved. But for the sake of the elect, whom He chose, He shortened the days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or ‘Look, there He is!’ do not believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For false christs and false prophets will rise and show signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But take heed. I have told you all things beforehand.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
the stars of heaven will fall,
    and the powers that are in heaven will be shaken.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then they will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He will send His angels and gather His elect from the four winds, from the farthest part of the earth to the farthest part of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now learn a parable of the fig tree: When her branch is yet tender and puts outs leaves, you know that summer is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also, when you see these things come to pass, know that it is near, even at the doors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will not pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But concerning that day or hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed, watch and pray. For you do not know when the time will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator
