verses.text: For the Son of Man is like a man leaving on a far journey who left his house and gave authority to his servants and to every man his work, and commanded the porter to watch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Watch therefore—for you do not know when the master of the house is coming, in the evening, or at midnight, or at the crowing of the rooster, or in the morning—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest he come suddenly and find you sleeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What I say to you I say to all: Watch!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the feasts of the Passover and of Unleavened Bread were two days away. And the chief priests and the scribes looked for a way to seize Him secretly and kill Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said “Not on the feast day, lest there will be an uproar among the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While He was in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as He sat at supper, a woman came with an alabaster jar of ointment, a very costly spikenard. She broke the jar and poured the ointment on His head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were some with indignation within themselves, saying, “Why was this ointment wasted?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It might have been sold for more than three hundred denarii and given to the poor.” And they grumbled against her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why do you trouble her? She has done a good work for Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You always have the poor with you, and whenever you wish, you may do good to them. But you will not always have Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She has done what she could. She has come beforehand to anoint My body for burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, wherever this gospel will be preached throughout the whole world, what she has done will also be spoken of as a memorial to her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went to the chief priests to betray Him to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard it, they were glad and promised to give him silver. So he looked for how he might conveniently betray Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of Unleavened Bread, when they sacrificed the Passover lamb, His disciples said to Him, “Where do You want us to prepare for You to eat the Passover?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He sent two of His disciples and said to them, “Go into the city, and a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you there. Follow him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever he enters, say to the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says, Where is the guest room where I may eat the Passover with My disciples?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will show you a large upper room, furnished and ready. Make preparations for us there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples went out, and came into the city, and found it as He had told them. And they prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the evening He came with the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they sat and ate, Jesus said, “Truly I say to you, one of you who is eating with Me will betray Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to be sorrowful and to say to Him one by one, “Is it I?” and another, “Is it I?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “It is one of the twelve, one who is dipping bread in the dish with Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man indeed goes as it is written concerning Him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been good for that man if he had never been born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were eating, Jesus took bread, blessed and broke it, and gave it to them, saying, “Take and eat it. This is My body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He took the cup, and when He had given thanks, He gave it to them. And they all drank from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “This is My blood of the new covenant, which is shed for many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, I will drink no more of the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to them, “All of you will fall away on account of Me this night, for it is written:
‘I will strike the shepherd,
    and the sheep will be scattered.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after I have risen, I will go before you to Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Him, “Even if all fall away, I will not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Truly, I say to you that this day, during the night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny Me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said more vehemently, “If I must die with You, I will not deny You.” They all said the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to a place which was named Gethsemane. And He said to His disciples, “Sit here while I pray.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took Peter and James and John with Him and began to be greatly distressed and very troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “My soul is deeply sorrowful unto death. Remain here and keep watch.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went a little farther and fell on the ground and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass from Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Abba, Father, all things are possible for You. Remove this cup from Me; yet not what I will, but what You will.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He came and found them sleeping and said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Could you not keep watch one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch and pray, lest you enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again He went away and prayed the same words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He returned, He again found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy. And they did not know what to answer Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He returned a third time, He said to them, “Are you still sleeping and taking your rest? It is enough! The hour has come. Look, the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rise up, let us go. Look! He who betrays Me is at hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately, while He was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a great crowd with swords and clubs, came from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he who betrayed Him had given them a sign, saying, “Whomever I kiss, He is the One. Seize Him and lead Him away safely.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So as soon as he came, he went to Him immediately and said, “Rabbi, Rabbi!” and kissed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They laid hands on Him and seized Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of those who stood by drew his sword and struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Have you come out with swords and clubs to arrest Me as you would a thief?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every day I was with you in the temple teaching, and you did not seize Me. But the Scriptures must be fulfilled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they all deserted Him and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young man followed Him, wearing a linen cloth around himself. And the young men laid hold of him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so he left the linen cloth, and fled from them unclothed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They led Jesus away to the high priest. And all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes were assembled with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter followed Him at a distance into the courtyard of the high priest. He sat with the guards and warmed himself by the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the chief priests and the entire Sanhedrin requested testimony against Jesus to put Him to death, but found none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many bore false witness against Him, but their testimonies did not agree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some rose up and bore false witness against Him, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We heard Him say, ‘I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and within three days I will build another not made with hands.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But still their testimony did not agree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest stood up in the midst and asked Jesus, “Do You answer nothing? What is it which these men testify against You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But He kept silent and answered nothing.
Again the high priest asked Him, “Are You the Christ, the Son of the Blessed One?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “I am. And you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power and coming with the clouds of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest tore his robes, saying, “What need do we have of any further witnesses?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have heard the blasphemy. What do you think?”
They all condemned Him as guilty unto death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some began to spit on Him, and to blindfold Him, and to strike Him, saying to Him, “Prophesy!” And the guards struck Him with the palms of their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the servant girls of the high priest came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she saw Peter warming himself, she looked at him and said, “You also were with Jesus of Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it, saying, “I neither know nor understand what you are saying.” Then he went out to the porch, and a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant girl saw him again and began to say to those who stood by, “This man is one of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But again, he denied it.
A little while later, those who stood by said again to Peter, “Surely, you are one of them. For you are a Galilean, and your speech confirms it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter began to invoke a curse on himself, and to swear, “I do not know this Man of whom you speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the rooster crowed a second time. And Peter called to mind the word that Jesus said to him, “Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny Me three times.” And when he thought on this, he wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early in the morning the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the whole Sanhedrin. And they bound Jesus and took Him away and handed Him over to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate asked Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?”
He answered him, “You have said so.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests accused Him of many things, but He answered nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate asked Him again, “Do You answer nothing? See how many things they testify against You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus still answered nothing, so that Pilate was astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at the feast he always released to them one prisoner, whomever they requested.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was one named Barabbas, who had committed murder in the insurrection and was bound with the rebels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd began crying aloud, asking Pilate to do as he had always done for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “Do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he knew that the chief priests had handed Him over out of envy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief priests stirred the people, so that he should instead release Barabbas to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate answered them again, “What then would you have me do to Him whom you call the King of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They again cried out, “Crucify Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate said to them, “Why, what evil has He done?”
But they cried out even more, “Crucify Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate, resolving to satisfy the people, released Barabbas to them. And when he had scourged Jesus, he handed Him over to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers led Him away to Praetorium Hall, and they called together the entire battalion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They clothed Him with a purple robe. And they wove a crown of thorns and put it on His head,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and began to salute Him, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They struck His head with a staff and spit on Him. And bowing their knees, they worshipped Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had mocked Him, they took the purple robe off of Him and put His own garments on Him. Then they led Him out to crucify Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They compelled a man named Simon from Cyrene, the father of Alexander and Rufus, as he was passing through from the country, to bear Jesus’ cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought Him to the place called Golgotha, which means, “Place of a Skull.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave Him wine mingled with myrrh to drink, but He did not take it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had crucified Him, they divided His garments, casting lots for them, to decide what each man should take.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was the third hour, and they crucified Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The inscription of His accusation was written above:
THE KING OF THE JEWS.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With Him they crucified two thieves, one on His right and the other on His left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Scripture was fulfilled, which says, “He was numbered with the lawless ones.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who passed by blasphemed Him, shaking their heads and saying, “Ah, You who would destroy the temple and build it in three days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: save Yourself, and come down from the cross!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise the chief priests mocked Him among themselves with the scribes and said, “He saved others, but He cannot save Himself!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the Christ, the King of Israel, descend now from the cross, that we may see and believe.” Those who were crucified with Him also reviled Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sixth hour had come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?” which means, “My God, My God, why have You forsaken Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of those who stood by, when they heard it, said, “Listen, He is calling Elijah!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One man ran and filled a sponge with vinegar, put it on a stick, and gave it to Him to drink, saying, “Leave Him alone. Let us see if Elijah will come to take Him down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus cried with a loud voice and gave up the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the centurion who stood facing Him saw that He cried out and gave up the spirit, he said, “Truly, this Man was the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were also women looking on from a distance, among whom were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the Less and of Joseph, and Salome.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also had followed Him and had ministered to Him when He was in Galilee. And many other women who came up with Him to Jerusalem were there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the evening had come, because it was the Day of Preparation, that is, the day before the Sabbath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph of Arimathea, an honorable member of the Council, who also waited for the kingdom of God, came and went in boldly to Pilate, and requested the body of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate wondered if He were already dead. And calling for the centurion, he asked him whether He had been dead for a while.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he learned about it from the centurion, he granted the body to Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he bought fine linen, and taking Him down, wrapped Him in the linen and laid Him in a tomb which had been hewn out of the rock. And he rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joseph saw where He was laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome, bought spices, so that they might go and anoint Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Very early in the morning, on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb at the rising of the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said among themselves, “Who will roll the stone away from the door of the tomb for us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they looked, they saw that the stone had been rolled away. For it was very large.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And entering the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, clothed in a long white robe. And they were frightened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Do not be frightened. You are looking for Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified. He is risen. He is not here. See the place where they laid Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But go your way, tell His disciples and Peter that He is going before you to Galilee. There you will see Him, as He told you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went out quickly and fled from the tomb, for they trembled and were amazed. And they said nothing to anyone, for they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus rose early on the first day of the week, He appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom He had cast seven demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She went and told those who had been with Him as they mourned and wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard that He was alive and had been seen by her, they did not believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that He appeared in another form to two of them as they walked and went into the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went and told it to the rest, but they did not believe them either.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward He appeared to the eleven as they sat at supper, and He reprimanded them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they did not believe those who had seen Him after He had risen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Go into all the world, and preach the gospel to every creature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who believes and is baptized will be saved. But he who does not believe will be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These signs will accompany those who believe: In My name they will cast out demons; they will speak with new tongues;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they will take up serpents; if they drink any deadly thing, it will not hurt them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will recover.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the Lord had spoken to them, He was received up into heaven and sat at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they went forth and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them and confirming the word through the accompanying signs. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
